content:
Yes, there are several great places to grab a bite to eat near Raby Castle. Here are a few options:

- The Coach House at Raby Castle: Located on the castle grounds, the Coach House is a popular spot for lunch or afternoon tea. It serves a variety of sandwiches, soups, and sweet treats, all made with locally sourced ingredients.

- The Crown at Mickleton: This cozy country pub is located about 5 miles from Raby Castle and serves a range of traditional pub food, including fish and chips, burgers, and pies. There is also a great selection of locally brewed beers and ciders.

- The Rose and Crown at Romaldkirk: This charming pub is located in the nearby village of Romaldkirk and serves a range of classic British dishes, as well as local game and seafood. The pub has a great atmosphere and is known for its friendly staff.

- The Teesdale Hotel: This hotel is located in the center of the nearby town of Middleton-in-Teesdale and serves a range of hearty pub fare, including steaks, pizza, and pasta. It also has a well-stocked bar with a great selection of wines and ales.

These are just a few of the many excellent options for dining after visiting Raby Castle. There are plenty of other great places to eat in the area, so I'm sure you'll be able to find something that suits your tastes.
